page.title: 06Farming - Broxwood Area
page.content:
This is a fertile area with a mild climate, made up principally of good leys ideal for growing many different crops including wheat, barley, oats, maize, hops, oil seed rape, potatoes, sprouts and beans. The area also cultivates soft fruits such as strawberries, blackcurrants and gooseberries and has orchards which contain both desert and cider apples.
Stock herds are predominantly Hereford crossed cattle, with Charolais and Limousin crosses as well. The dairy herds are mainly Friesians. The world famous Haven Herefords are in this area and bulls are exported to USA, Canada, Africa, Australia and Scandinavia. It is also a good area for sheep with a pedigree flock of Clun and many commercial flocks with predominately Suffolk rams.
